intro: Schrebera latialata, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a striking tropical tree native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy red flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a dramatic visual display. The plant has compound leaves with long, slender leaflets that give it a feathery appearance. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Schrebera latialata is also valued for its ability to provide shade and support local wildlife.
